text: Ive been largely disappointed with this restaurant. I always order the same meal and its always a different price. That is absolutely ridiculous. I've also found large black hairs in my food twice. Yukk! I see that another reviewer found a rubber band in his meal. How does that happen? THIS PLACE IS WAY OVER PRICED! This is Americanized buffet Chinese food at best.

Delivery was timely but food was not good.  We ordered pot stickers, egg drop soup, chicken chowmein, chicken teriyaki, and Mongolian beef.  The only thing that was edible was the rice that came with the entrees.  The egg drop soup and chowmein were mediocre at best.  I am a huge fan of Chinese food and 
It was approximately $50 for all items 
Again, service and delivery were good but the food was disappointing.

Stopped by to pick up a quick meal. Ordered the alluring on photo Hong Kong Chow Mein and gravely disappointed. It's mainly veggies, noodles and meat mixed together...that's it. Was I expecting too much?

They gave me additional food when I picked up my order, and then called me asking for it back once I had gone through everything.   I asked if they planned on reselling the same order to the right customer after I had handled it (health code violation/gross.)  They insisted they were going to throw it away.  If that's the case, why did I have to drive it back?  Either way, an inconvenience for me, and possibly my hair in your food.

Placed an order first time for delivery was quoted an hour got my order in 30 minutes       Fast delivery.  Mongolian beef  and beef broccoli  lunch specials were graeat huge portions for 5.95.   Will be ordering again

Ordered for New Year's eve dinner.  The food was fabulous.  When they say spicy they mean spicy.  Each to go container was full to the brim. The soup was delicious.  Probably the least greasiest Chinese food I've ever had.  We all loved our meal.  We get a coupon in the mail regularly so even better. The food was very reasonable and we had plenty for some leftover meals and only spend little more than $30.

Why should you eat here?  My mom likes it.  She was born in Shanghai and raised in Hong Kong.  She's really picky about her Chinese food, and usually avoids these types of takeout places.  Price is right, ingredients are fresh, and the service is fast.  There are very few good Chinese restaurants in Summerlin, but this is one of them.
By far the best Chinese food I've had for a very long time. The portions were large and they don't skimp on the more expensive ingredients.

Had a great meal at China One. Food was great. LARGE PORTIONS !!! WOW HAVE ENOUGH FOR 2 MORE MEALS.  Service was great. Has a lot of variety. Atmosphere was quiet and relaxed. The place was very clean. Will definitely come back.
Good chinese food, portion size, and dollar-to-bite ratio.  Friendly enough service and excellent location.

This place is just ok, but it does so much take-out business.  There is just no competition for them in Summerlin.  Most peeps love chinese food and just want to pick up something quick on the way home.  They are fast, but some dishes are too salty.  I do wish there was another choice here to give them some competition.

This place is great. The lunch specials are very reasonably priced and comes with more food than most people would eat in a sitting. Opt to eat in and you get egg drop soup too. The kung pay chicken was legit. I love Spivey food and this actually had enough heat that I enjoyed it. So I would say font get it if you're not able to tolerate spice very well. Staff was friendly and foot was piping hot when I got it.

The food is good and the delivery was fast!
I ordered Mongolian Beef and Fried Rice they said it would take 45 minutes and my food was delivered within 15 minutes.
The food was good and it was not too saucy or drenched in soy sauce like many other fast food Chinese places.
I will order from here again =)

I'm a regular at China One, even though this isn't one of the best Chinese food places. They do certain things really well so I keep going back. But unless you order a chicken dish that has breading and is deep-fried, the chicken is rubbery. Fatty. Slimy. Just know what to order and you will enjoy it.
No too bad, not too good. It's right around the corner from where I live and they deliver.  I'd get it again but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there or order in.
Excellent food, quick reliable delivery

The lunch special is really a great deal, big portions and delicious food. Really like their Mongolian Beef and General Chicken using white meat(gonna be $1 extra but worth). Friendly services, Stan helped us out. My new #1 place for Chinese food. thank you ChinaOne!

i placed an order with china one for delivery. one of the items was the potstickers. when i received my order the potstickers were different from what i have ordered from them before. i called china one and they said they we changed the kind of potsticker they used and instead of calling me to tell me that, they just sent it with the delivery driver. they said they would give me a credit so i said ok. i went back to the restaurant the next night to get my credit applied to a different order and they said they will only give me the same potstickers (that were wrong in the first place!!!!) for the credit. i said i dont want them thats why i called to complain!!! all i asked for is a messly $6 credit off the price of my bill. i did not want anything for free just what was promised me! will never go there again. itys not the money, its the priciple. dont promise me something and then take it back.
Great food, fast service, very fresh, I like the generals chicken with white meat only, very delicious, also lunch specials are a steal

Finally we live in a neighborhood with a great Chinese joint.  Love this place and if you like doughy dumplings, you will love theirs.  We get them everytime!!  Service is great and the food comes out quick and HOT!   Love it and highly recommend it.
Very good and really fresh. Ordered orange chicken' Hunan beef and beef and broc. Everything was wonderful with friendly service. I'll be back!

I eat here when I am really desperately craving Chinese food. It reminds me of the Chinese fast food places serving up fried chicken and fried rice. They are slightly better than those. They use the same sauce for all their dishes and any changes to the order is hard. I always ask for no msg and am told that the meats are marinated in it so they can't do anything about it. I ask for low sodium and they accommodate by reducing the amount of brown sauce they slather over it. They have ok prices and are a decent place to go to when really searching for Chinese. Now that Dim Sum Cafe has opened nearby, I have a second option.

Update.
This is my third visit. I ordered Mongolian Beef (the one I had great experience with during the first visit). All I have to say is, the food tastes good this time, but the beef is still awful.

I don't have more to say except this to the owner. Please use the same beef you use before. This batch of beef is terrible. Too many tendons in there, some are too soft (baking soda burn) some are too hard to chew (full of tendons).

4 star for the taste
1 star for the beef

my second time eating here this time just to try the sweet & sour lunch special .. which  made out to be another decent meal . my 1st visit was for dinner where my significant other & i tried calimari , fried chicken wings , spinach & a host of other dishes . which were all none the least up to par . only downside was being charged an extra 2.50 just to change my white rice to brown which ended up not being cooked through all the way so was slightly hard . regardless thee portions were slightly huge & delightful for a pick me upper

China One is great for take out. I always love the Wonton soup when I'm not feeling well. The crab Rangoon's are delicious and I love their Honey Walnut Shrimp. My husbands favorite is the House Chow Fun noodles. Service is always quick and friendly.
Can't go wrong with crispy beef and pan fried noodles.  Good neighborhood Chinese food.

The worse Chinese soup I had in a long time. Very nice area, where u never think can be this kind a food, people where nice too, first but then when I got rip off paying for soup then I saw she could be nice and tell just order this item and u will get the same, but wasn't big deal until I paid extra what I need and make sure first it's the right one, then they were telling me it's white meat...

I would give them three stars except for one thing.  There is a serious problem with how they prepare shrimp.  I had shrimp in their Honey Walnut Shrimp, and House Chow Fun.  The shrimp tasted like dirt.  I think this is because they don't properly prepare the shrimp and devein it.  This was a problem in both dishes.  I could pick the shrimp out of the Chow Fun, but the Honey Walnut Shrimp dish was ruined and inedible.  I won't be ordering from them again.

Got take out last night and came out good. Packed nicely and folks very professional. Ordered egg and crab egg foo young, walnut prawns - nice size and quantity, tofu and vegetables. All very tasty and not so greasy except the egg foo young but what the hey it's fried hellloo... I would come back.

Eaten here a handful of times and it's always been good. I've had better at several places but it's close by and the delivery is quick.
On this occasion I ordered take out via online..
I wrote on 3 separate pages that I would like extra chili sauce, paste, packets on the side.. And didn't get even one!
The soup was super blank and that curry which I ordered spicy wasn't even a level one spicy
They make some bomb (delicious!) bbq pork fried rice! its not dry and bland like other places. Fills me up every time after a long day of work.
Excellent service. Great customer service. Pleasantly surprised. They took direction to the T which was great (i.e. easy sauce, extra crispy, etc.)   I'll order again.
Good food and quick delivery. Everything I've had from there is good, but it is different from the Chinese food from back home. No almond boneless chicken for example.

This Chinese restaurant is pretty decent. I'm usually very picky on Chinese food, but last time I was very SATISFIED with my orders of Spinach, Mapo Tofu, & Mogonlian Beef.  I've to admit that some dishes are kinda too salty for me, but if I just ask for less sauce, it would be perfect for me. 

I'd highly recommend this place

There quality has give down hill. I have been going here since they opened. The last two times we've ordered from here the quality just hasn't been the same. The Chow Mein noodles were different and the flavor was a little off I also ordered a Thai iced tea which was not sweetened and a taro boba did not taste good. In fact, the taro boba was not finished.  On the positive, the sesame beef tasted good as usual, but I don't think it's enough for me to order from them again.

What a surprise?! Looking for some great Chinese food in Summerlin? This place is great. Large portions for a small price. The service is excellent. Everyone is very nice. It has a small restaurant feel rather than a fast food take out. Do not be deceived by your eyes! Plus they deliver!!!
Always great food and the service is nice. I live right around the corner and when I'm totally lazy and not up to drive. They deliver very promptly. Thanks!

This is my new go to Chinese place. In fact, I almost ran the idea of paying them a monthly sum to eat there every meal, and avoid cooking myself. The ingredients are fresh, the food is very tasty for a takeout place, and the portion is large compare to the price.  My favorite is KongPao Chicken, the Walnut Shrimp is very good too.

I went in for the lunch special of general tso chicken and it was the most disgusting, salty thing I ever ate. It was basically sauce with a little chicken. Rice was undercooked and had no flavor except salt. I'd go eat grocery story sushi before eating at this dump. It's also very dirty inside. Stay away!!

Huge portions where spicy really does mean spicy!  We dropped in for a quick dinner and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food.  We were not as impressed by our sticky table top.  However, the staff is friendly, the service is fast, and the prices are affordable.

Friendly service, and solid American Chinese offerings. Ask for adjustments like "light sauce" or "extra spicy" or changeup the menu's sauce defaults altogether for variety. It's fun to customize your own dish, and this wok shop will oblige - with a smile!

My favorite now is Fish Filet with "light Hot Garlic sauce, extra spicy, with string beans only and brown rice."

I'm a fan!

I'm impressed. I ordered the Mongolia beef and crab rangoons. Was all perfect. The rangoons were perfectly crispy and the cream cheese was still cool. The Mongolian beef was VISIBLY high quality meat and veggies. I could see even before tasting that the dish was top grade and the flavors proved it. 

They have a big menu with mostly Chinese entrees but a few Thai as well. Also, they had smoothies but I was entirely satisfied with the meal already. 

Timing was good. There was a huge order before me and several after and mine was still in reasonable time. 
Staff is friendly and very helpful. 
Place is clean and fresh. Small but unless they are extremely busy then no need for more size.
Decorated in traditional Chinese lanterns and good luck signs. 
The only reason that I gave 4 is because...it's only fast food. I mean, this could be a restaurant if they only changed the size. This still beats some full staff restaurants but I'm grading them hard because I'm comparing them to a full size restaurant even though they are fast food.

Really good Chinese food, probably some of the best Chinese take-out I've had.  If you're looking for really goopy, greasy Chinese, this probably isn't your best bet.  They use pretty fresh ingredients, especially for take-out, and it's healthier than your average Chinese take-out while still satisfying cravings.  And, when they say a dish is spicy, it actually is somewhat spicy which is a nice change!
Perfect combination chow mein.  Crab rangoon needs more crab; then would be just right.

China One is a great take out/delivery place in the heart of Summerlin!
I just recently discovered their awesome lunch specials.
Lunch specials are available until 4pm daily. It is served with fried or steamed rice and chow mein. They also have egg drop soup with the lunch special but this is not included in takeout orders. Lunch special prices are from $5.95 to $6.50. (The higher priced lunch specials are those dishes that have seafood).

I got to try two lunch specials from here. They were the L8: Moo Goo Chicken and the L10: Chicken in Hot Garlic Sauce. I was pleasantly surprised with both lunch specials. They were very generous with their servings. There was a fair share of fried rice and chow mein and there was so much chicken in the entrees. Not only did this place have great portions, the food was good as well. The Chicken in Hot Garlic sauce had a nice spicy and sweet flavor to it. The Moo Goo Chicken had a more subtle flavor to it. The emphasis on the Moo Goo Chicken was more on the veggie/mushroom flavor. Both chicken dishes were delicious and both had their distinct, unique flavors. I liked that this place had delicious and generous entrees. It was plenty of food for lunch and there was plenty for dinner as well.

China One also sends coupons in the mail. For spending over $10, I got my choice of free egg rolls or crab ragoons. I chose to get 2 free crab ragoons. The crab ragoons were yummy. It was crispy and hot and when it arrived. It was filled with lots of cream cheese! There were two types of sweet and sour dipping sauces that came with it too.

I think China One will be my new number one go-to place for quick and yummy Chinese takeout/delivery when I am in Vegas :). Yay!

It is what it is.  It isn't the best Chinese you're ever going to have, but it's pretty inexpensive and it is typical fast food Chinese.  I wouldn't drive out of my way to go there, but if I was in the mood for Chinese and live up here (which I do), it's not bad.

I live about 5 minutes from this place but I never bothered.  Finally went in for lunch.  They have a smaller lunch special menu.  My friend ordered the spicy garlic pork and I ordered the Singapore mei fun of the regular menu.  I was expecting Americanized Chinese food and that's exactly what I got.  Of course, this isn't a bad thing.  The food was on point with the sauces made right and the quantity generous.  Is it worth driving across town for?  Probably not, but if you live in the Summerlin area, it's worth going to.   Dining in is pretty quiet.  Bulk of their business seems to be delivery and takeout.

Had horrible service tonight. It took an hour & 45 minutes to get delivered & the restaurant called us twice to ask how we were tipping the driver. Really?! We usually order at least 2 times a month from this restaurant. But, after tonight we will no longer order from here again! Then last time they forgot our pot stickers we paid for in our bag so they said we had a credit. Well when we called today they had no record of there previous mess up. I don't recommend this restaurant, go elsewhere.

I ordered from this place regularly for the couple years I've been here but all it takes is one experience to turn me away from them for good. I ordered a few items for takeout for me and my toddler (hot n sour, wonton soup, noodles and chicken veg). I serve myself some of the wonton soup and my toddler the noodles first. Good thing I didn't give her any soup first because in my first serving of wonton soup I found 2 shards of sharp plastic in my first few spoons of broth. Then another in my next. Wtf?  If I served my toddler first she probably would've choked on this. I called the restaurant and was informed that this is normal as their delivery containers sometimes arrive damaged. Wtf?

The fact they still use damaged containers to serve their customers speaks all kinds of unethical practices that are probably going on in their kitchen. They just lost a regular customer and gained an advocate against their establishment.

I have been to this place multiple times and I am honestly not a fan. This isn't a traditional Chinese restaurant, of course, but at least make an effort to make it taste like food. I ordered a large tray of chow mein. As we were eating, I had happen to find a random rubber band in the noodles ... Mhmm. Also, the food is a little too oily. Anyway, at least the servers are patient and kind when taking orders. Just my opinion.
Very good place! The food was really good and the service was awesome. The food didn't take long at all, and it was piping hot!

Great food. Large portions and reasonable prices. Try the spicy chicken wings they are great. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because they do not have BBQ spare ribs on the menu. Almost every Chinese take out restaurant has spare ribs. The only thing comparable in flavor is the BBQ sliced pork.
I'm a Utahn but try to hit this up every time I'm here! So good!

I just want to add a caveat that when I came in here I was starving and uber grouchy.  I think hangry is the right term.

Good selection of Chinese and even some Thai options.  We got the Kung Pao Beef, Orange Chicken, sautéed broccoli, egg rolls and butterfly shrimp. 

Kung Pao beef was well spiced and tasty.  Orange chicken was good but this dish is hard to mess up and didn't wow me.  Egg rolls were crisp and tasty.  Best of all was the sautéed broccoli actually!  Still crisp so it wasn't overcooked and just the right amount of garlic.  Well worth the broccoli farts I subjected my lady to.  

One downside was it was over $40 for the two of us.  Granted, we are both fat kids and got two apps but still

China One - near my house - CHECK, Amazing Food - Double CHECK, Fast service - Triple CHECK. We frequented China One when we lived in this awesome Summerlin 'hood five years ago. China One welcomed us back with open arms a few months ago. I love the food, the service (the register girls are soooo sweet!), and the specials. When my family is craving Chinese food, and do not want to venture far, just veg on the couch kind of night, this is our place. My husband also wanted to add that China One's Teriyaki Bowls are the best ever. He says they top S.S's by 20 and are so much more reasonable in price. The Mustard here is amazing, and so is the paper (foil) wrapped chicken. China One is most definitely a once a week place for us! - Love Summerlin Local!
Good food and great service. Portions were surprisingly large and wonton soup was great.

We went over there thinking it's similar to panda express but this place is different. The portion sizes are really huge good for two people. Stan helped us with the orders and he was very good with helping us to figure out right food.

Some of the best Chinese food we have had. Typically the rice used for fried rice is always very dry. This was just perfect. If you like spicy food, try their spicy chicken wings, just out of the world good. Kung Pao chicken hit the spot

We frequent this place once a month.

For the most part they are great for dinner.  On our most recent take out experience was pleasant.  Tonight, we ordered the "Dinner A" which consisted of:

- Egg Drop Soup
- 2 Spring Rolls
- 2 Cream Cheese Ragoons
- Pork Fried Rice (our choice)
- Orange Chicken (our choice)
- Chicken Chow Mein (our choice)

The total came out to under $28.

Food was prepared quickly.  The restaurant was clean and the employees were nice.

When we came home our food was nice and hot.  Each take out box was filled to the brim and our family of five were completely satisfied.

One thing that had me raise my eyebrow was the fact that at the bottom of our orange chicken box, it was lined with broccoli.

The over all experience has been positive! :)  The service is consistent and we had a memorable experience when the place first opened:  We dined in and they were super friendly and gave away freebies and extra food and were very accommodating to our rambunctious little boys.

When we are in the mood for Chinese at home, China One is the number one choice for us.

We love this place. We have been coming here since it opened. We have tried almost everything on the menu. The Hunan Beef being our favorite...so tasty!  It's always hot and ready to go for pick up in 10 to 15 minutes. Staff is always great...food is always great and consistent.

China One is my go to place. I love love love this place.

This place is practically my neighbor, so it's really easy for me to either stop by and pick up or call and have lunch or dinner delivered to my home.

We often have family calling from the airport to let my husband or I know, "i'm boarding my flight.  I'll see you in a few!" or  "I'm here!" Needless to say, I'm often unprepared. 

Whether ordering a shrimp, chicken, beef or pork dish, they are never stingy with the portions.

And its cold and flu season again. Nothing like a bowl of hot won ton or egg drop soup to help sooth a soar throat.

So far, everything I've tried here has been great.

Good food and quick service. I love the house fried rice. I'm still trying out some of the entrees. So far I like some and not others. But that's really a personal preference thing that will vary by customer. I'll definitely be back.
Ewww! Stay far away from this place! What kind of Chinese food is this! Defintely not from Hawaii or San Fransisco! What happened  to the taste? Not good at all!

I have been coming to this place and I always order on yelp24 that way I can just go in and out of the place without waiting inside. That wasn't the case tonight, I i order online set up a pick up time and i got there only to find out that my order was wrong and had to wait 20 minutes so they can make the right order. So, got home, checked my food and it was all greasy! The crab foo yung was swimming in grease and my husband had to drain it with paper towels. What a disappointment! I will never go back or order from this place ever again.

Best Chinese food I've had yet.
 No bean sprouts in fried rice which is different.

Orange chicken was delicious and nicely coated. There were a few tiny pieces which were over cooked.

Overall it's good, even reheated leftovers!!

My kids love this place.  We order the Family Dinner B most times. It's a great value for the amount of food you receive.  They have coupons which can be used for free food items or $5 off, which is great.  The house fried rice is really good with whole shrimp. Sweet and sour chicken is always a favorite with the kids.  The food is consistently good, always hot and fresh. We order take out and delivery equally, both options are great and there's never been an error with any of our orders.

I knew not to expect to much. However, I was pleasantly somewhat surprised. It wasn't great or anything, but some items were pretty good...some eh. The egg rolls I would never order again. I like the deep fried thick crust egg rolls..yum. These are the overly fried and oily spring rolls. No bueno.
I did like the string beans and sesame beef. It's so close to home, I'll come back again and try something else.

I ordered dinner from China a Go Go  to be delivered..
This was my mistake. The last time I asked for delivery they said 45 minutes and I waited  close to 2 hours.
I thought I'd give them one more chance and the exact same wait ensued. It finally arrived not even warm because it obviously was on the delivery van for so long.
The worst part ,however was the quality of the food.
It was and I say was pretty good when they opened.
THIS TIME I ordered  teriyaki chicken . It was beyond bad.
The chicken was made up of scraps of dark meat complete with grizzle and gizzards too. 
There was no gravy to speak of either. it looked like glue strung on top of the close to inedible chicken.
Now I love to give a good review and have many times but not this time.
Learn from my experience and stay away from them....
My previous review stands as far as value, taste, portion size and location in proximity to my house.  I am dropping a star because I don't think brown rice is worth a $2.50 upcharge.
Coming from San Francisco, the bar on Chinese food was set high and sadly China One doesn't come close.

It was a very quick delivery. Excellent service. We ordered the egg foo young, it was very delicious although really greasy. We also ordered the Pad Thai which I was not a fan of, my husband liked it, but...he was also liking the bathroom the next day. Over all it was okay I will definitely give it another shot!

This is my go to Chinese place to eat. It's so close to my house and it delicious. The service it fantastic to and my favorite dish has to be the chow fun. If we are feeling sick come here for there fantastic soup. To me it's the best Chinese place in the area.

I went riding my bike with a group of people and we decided to stop here for lunch. It's a small little place maybe holds about 30 people in total. The service is fast I order the Kung Pao chicken. It was a little spicy. Which is supposed to be laughing out loud. The portions are very generous. overall it was really good service was fast.

Awesome place. Was on my way out of redrocks when I found this spot. The food was awesome (I had the House Chow Mein) and they definitely won't leave you hungry with all that food. They were even nice enough to let me hangout for an hour and edit photos on my laptop. Next time I'm in town I'll be back for sure!
China One is a good restaurant to grab a tasty fast meal. They wok their food fresh to order and we have always enjoyed both delivery and dining at the restaurant. I would recommend China One.

I wanted a light dinner so I went to China One and got some Corn egg drop soup.  It was quite a lot--a portion two people could easily share.

I did take out and of course they were quick as the soup is one of the standards that are always ready.

I'll be back to try some of their entrées, perhaps even try one of the lunch specials that my fellow Yelpers recommend.

I had an awful situation with this restaurant: i made an order via yelp, and was waited for two hours, until decided to call to the restaurant and ask how my order is going. It didn't even started. They said they didn't see any orders from Yelp (!!!). Then they called to Eat24 and called me back to say that my order doesn't exist in their system too, cool huh?
So  i ordered my food straight from China one. Me and my husband ordered two types of chicken and they were fine, but his fried rice wasn't really fried, and my brown rice was tasteless. When i got my order - there were no Tai tea, even if i ordered it. But in the bill that i signed for the courier, there was Tai tea! So how **** is that? After i called to China One to ask about my drink, they said that don't have any tai tea today. WHAAAAT? So they put it in the bill but didn't have it to bring to me?!
And now with my bank information - Eat24 charged me and China one charged me, twice for the same order!  NEVER AGAIN.
Stumbled upon this joint after leaving Red Rock Canyon.  Food was decent, better than Panda Express.

I wanted to find a place close to home that served Fried Pork Chops so I could eat it with our leftover Chinese food. When I called in my order I asked if it was enough for 3 people. The lady said ,"I don't know it depends how much you eat". I thought that was funny ...but for the record it was more then enough for three people. We even had left overs that lasted for one or two more meals. It tasted okay it wasn't as crunchy as I would have liked it to be and it had a weird aftertaste. I wouldn't mind coming back and trying out one of their lunch specials though.

China One is a fast food Chinese restaurant in Summerlin on the corner of W Charleston and Desert Foothills in the Albertson's Shopping Plaza. This place is okay for a fast food Chinese place. It has a small dining area and you can see the kitchen from the dining area, which I don't mind at all. I like to see the kitchen to see if it is clean or dirty. The place looked like it was clean.

They have the regular Chinese menu you find at every Chinese restaurant. I ordered the Szechuan Beef with no msg, fried rice with chicken. The other people with me ordered Beef and broccoli, General Tsao's chicken, and Mongolian Beef. It was all pretty good for a fast food place. It was what I expected. The only complaint I have is that I ordered my food spicy and it was not spicy at all.

I would recommend trying it out for a quick bite to eat.

There are certain items I like to try whenever I see them on a menu. I like to try a place's Jambalaya or Risotto or Paella, I make sure to order Panang Curry at Thai places, and I'm a bit of a General Tso's Chicken addict. Thanks to Bobby Y's review, I knew I had to check out China One for some GTC action.

I went here with my Dad late one night. I wasn't all that hungry, so we ordered some fried rice to share. It was enough to feed and satisfy both of our appetites. The fried rice was pretty good, but a little on the oily side. Then again, I may have only noticed the oil because of the styrofoam plates we were eating on. The plates were absolutely covered in oil by the end!

As for the GTC, I got it to go. So yes, this is not a review of freshly cooked China One GTC. I took it to work the next day and had so much food, I split it up into lunch part one and lunch part two. Even reheated the next day, the GTC was solidly good eats. The vegetables weren't so fresh anymore, but I like the fact that it even comes with vegetables. My usual go-to GTC lunch destination is Chopstix; they don't include veggies, so this was a nice change-up.

I'll have to return for the lunch special GTC and eat in next time. Not that I was disappointed in the GTC - not at all. It was very good and worthy of returning, even though there are probably a ton of equally good places between my house and China One.

Whenever I had walked from my car to the Dunkin Donuts in the Charleston at Desert Foothills Albertson's Shopping Center, I had been curious how good the Chinese restaurant I had been walking by is. So today, I would give China One a try.

    Without a menu outside, I was lured inside the restaurant. When I walked inside, I saw a take out style Chinese Restaurant with some tables. The menu was displayed on a large board on the wall. When I looked at the menu, I saw a similar menu to the majority of the Chinese Restaurants that I have patronized in Las Vegas. The average lunch special (served to 4 PM.) started around $6. The shrimp based entrees were slightly higher priced.

   For something in the ballpark of $8.38 plus a $1  tip; I chowed down a lunch special that included noodles with duck sauce (Yes! I did not have to leave my seat and ask for the duck sauce.), egg drop soup (for dining in), pepper steak, fried rice, and chow mien noodles. With the food, I drank from a cup of Coke that is fairly large for a Chinese Restaurant. The food was OK. Nothing sensational where it would make my day if they added a store in my neighborhood, and not bad. My minor complaint is that too much of the plate was taken up by chow mien noodles, which I regard as filler.

  The employees were friendly. I was greeted as soon as I walked in the door. They checked up on me to make sure that the food was good, It was when I was about to leave that left me a positive last impression of China One. When I paid and they were cleaning my table, the nice woman that works there refilled my fairly large cup of soda to drink after I left. In some cases it is the last impression that is memorable. And in this case, the last impression influenced me in giving China One a three star rating.

This is one of the best take out Chinese in Las Vegas. The food is always fresh and smoking hot. The Crab Rangoon is so creamy!! The Mongolian Beef is always perfect. Kung Pao? Oh wow! It's great! My fave is the Salt Pepper Shrimp .....it is so spicy hot my eyes tear up!! The service is always prompt and friendly. It's not much to look at for a dine in experience, but for take out/delivery it is the bomb!

I wish I worked near a China One.  Yes, I did eat dinner here, but after seeing their lunch menu I feel like I'm missing out on some great value!  The food here is good and made to order, though it kind of screams, "Order our food to go!" with all the plates and utensils being styrofoam or plastic.  Lunch specials were in the $5-$6 range and seemed to include noodles, rice, and an egg roll with your meal; quite the deal!  Dinner plates were in the $8-$9 range.

I tried the spicy garlic chicken with brown rice, and was very pleased with my selection.  Some of those peppers had me sweating...the spicy is no joke!  I also got a taste of a shrimp dish; not sure what it was, but it was very tasty.  The staff here was also very accommodating: putting together tables for our large group, cancelling orders without issue when customers ordered too much food, and helping sort out some hiccups in communication when it came to questions about the menu.  All in all a positive experience, but unfortunately China One lies a little off the beaten path for me to visit regularly.

Love China One- this is our go-to place at least once a week.  Our fav's are Shrimp w/ salt and pepper, Snow pea and shrimp, and wonton soup.  All are excellent and fresh, not at all greasy.  Delivery is lightning fast.
Favorite Chinese take out place - super fast delivery and super fresh food!  Never had to wait more than 30 minutes for order - usually delivered within 15-20...can't beat that.

I like it. I like it a lot. 

Especially for busy nights when we don't have "what's for dinner" on our radar....granted, it's not a Michelin rated restaurant or anything...but I rate within perspective and relativity. 

I use the Yelp Eat 24 app and literally I order, pay, and tip with the click of an iPhone button, and when the food arrives, it goes like this:

Ding dong. 
Open door. Hi. 
Here's the food. 
Thanks. Bye. 
Close door. 

And, the app remembers your orders so that the next time you want to order the same thing...clickety-click-click and boom, you're done. FOOD EN ROUTE. 

We order fried rice, chow mien, wings...easy Chinese comfort food and every time the food is consistently good. 

It's nice to have an easy, reliable option...especially when we work demanding jobs.  For the price, the ease, and the food...5 stars all day long!

Ordered food online, hot and sour soup requested for "hot spicy" and the soup was hot but not spicy.  Their chow fun was ok if you're really hungry.  Being hungry and lazy to drive farther than 1.5 miles, this place was good enough. 

This place is pretty pricey too for a fast food joint maybe because it's in Summerlin but still!  I'd go elsewhere if I really wanted Chinese food.

I'm torn between a 3 & 4 rating the food definitely a 4 but for the prices the food being served with plastic spoons, styrofoam cups for hot soup, paper plates the prices should be 7.00 a dish rather the. 12.75 +.  We had 2 dishes and soup for almost 40.00 with tip that's almost like PF Changs.  

Suggestion install a dishwasher and get real silverware and dishes :-)

Large portions, decent price, and I liked the generals chicken lunch special. Good quality veggies in with the chicken and not just the dried red chillies like in most cheap Chinese food, but some actual small green chilies. Overall great especially for the price. But my quest for amazing General's Chicken continues.

Waited 2 hours for food guy calls me and tells me that lady called me and said up to 90 minutes! No one called me and he goes well do you want it!!! Annoyed and hungry but I don't what it! On page said 45/60 minutes!

If you don't like a lot of salt make sure to ask them not to add salt to the already salty sauces!  They also claim to not use MSG but I beg to differ!  I have reactions to MSG and when I eat here I get the side effect from MSG.

One of my favorite quick-eat Chinese places. Mao Po tofu, without pork, is the shiiiit! This place is great for vegetarian eaters, because they'll happily replace any meat with tofu for you, and it always comes out awesome.

Usually get food here to-go, but if you do choose to eat in, they have good service, unless they're busy.

This place deserves 3.5 stars but since I got coupons in the mail, China One gets the 0.5 star boost.

I live around the corner from the place so whenever I crave Chinese food, this is the only place I go.  And let me mention that I've only ordered to-go, although they do have ~5 tables for patrons to eat there. 

To-go service is so speedy!  Order by phone or just sit and wait for the food - either is fine & quick. 

FOOD:  (they give a carton of rice--plenty--per each entree dish ordered)

- shrimp with vegetables: felt like there were more vegetables than shrimp, or at least the to-go box was PACKED with veggies on the top with a layer of peanuts on top of that. Had to dig down to find a shrimp.  This dish wasn't anything special.

- walnut shrimp: good, typical, no complaints with it

- general chicken: it is actually a LITTLE bit spicy reflecting that chili pepper next to the dish.  You know how sometimes places like to put those chilis next to spicy dishes when in reality they aren't?! Well this place is somewhat accurate.

Had a coupon for free 12 fried chicken wonton for spending $20.  They were SO GOOD!  Warm, crispy outside with a hearty nugget of chicken inside.  This whole side could have been my meal. 

BOTTOM LINE: decent Chinese food, they cook/prepare the food quick if you order to-go, try to get some coupons!

The service here could be friendlier, and they now charge heftily for brown rice. You would think brown rice was gold! If I were in the area, I would still run in for my old stand by broccoli and tofu lunch special, but it's not a stand alone lunch destination for me any longer as our neighborhood China One far exceeds this location in quality of service.

Delicious, well-prepared and light Chinese food. A friend and I stopped here for dinner after a rock climbing trip and were very pleasantly surprised by the high quality of the food. Everything was fresh and cooked perfectly. Not greasy like some Chinese food, either. Fast and pleasant service, and reasonable prices. A real find. I'll definitely be bringing friends here during our next trip out.

This food is very "American" but really good. They are really fast at getting the orders out. I have never had a bad meal from here. Takeout is just as good as dining in. Prices are reasonable and staff are friendly. Orange chicken and Won Ton Soup are the best.
come to this place for take out and they will expect you to tip them. for what? they make the food and you pick it up. and if you don't they will yell at you. very rude. food isn't the best. just ok.
This place is horrible. I ordered take out and after getting half way through each of my take out boxes realized my food was swimming in oil half the box was food and half was greasy oil.

I phoned in my order to pick up for Won Ton Soup and to get the free egg rolls I needed to spend $10 so I got the Hong Kong Crispy Noodles.  So I spent $16+ instead.  I live 2 minutes away so why not try it?  

It was ready for me by the time I got there as promised and waiting for me on the counter.  I was not greeted or acknowledged as 3 cashiers/workers were staring at the cash register as if it was some kind of video game.  I greeted them instead and told them my name.  They check ID when you pay with credit card so I handed them my government issued ID.  It took her a minute to find my name that matched my credit card and I told her where she could find it.  THEN, she asked me "where did you get this.?"  So, that just pissed me off more!!!  Really?  Was she about to question me about my ID?  

SO I finally went home and told myself if their service is this bad their food better be good.  I'm glad that they took the time to separate the noodles and the sauce.  I put everything together and it was so salty.  The noodles I threw away because I felt ashamed to even share with the rest of my family.  The soup had fried shrimp in it so it made my soup oily.  I ate half of the soup and put it into the refrigerator thinking it might taste better the next day.   I added water the next day and finally ate the rest.  

I'm giving them 2 stars because they were fast and I'm sure they pay a lot for their location in Summerlin so here's a free one.  

The only thing I liked was the free won ton chips you get with sweet and sour sauce.  I wonder how much they charge for that?  If it's $1 I think I might go back for those.

Eat here every week, Honey Walnut Shrimp and Mongolian Beef are my go-to.

When I'm poor and starving the chicken chow mein is the move for only $7.50.

Prob best China One in town, staff is friendly and they are always working hard to get your food out in ten minutes or less.

Love this place.

The food was wonderful yet the restaurant itself could use a little work. It is a place you order for delivery or pick up. I sat at a sticky table and couldn't help but notice the dirty floor. 

All that aside the main dish The Chicken in Hot Garlic Sauce was excellent a must try.

My brother told the lady over the phone he was paying cash and the driver brought NO CHANGE for delivery then went around asking my neighbors if they had change when my brother told him he would ask us for some.  Tacky tacky tacky and possibly a ploy to get a larger tip.
I you haven't tried China One, it's a great 'On-the-Way-Home' Pick Up Spot! They are convenient and quick. Also they are always willing to customize forVegan Dishes
Finally a bomb Chinese spot near my new place. The food was Filled with flavor and the plates was full. The price is also really good. Now when I'm craving for Chinese food I know where to go.

I have been eating here about once a week for about 2 years. The food is consistently very good, with large portions and good quality ingredients. When I moved from Henderson to Summerlin I was worried that I wouldn't find a Chinese take out anywhere as good as China A Go Go, but this comes pretty close. Some of my favorites include Singapore Noodles, War Wonton Soup, and Chicken w/broccoli. The only improvement I'd really like to see is them taking American Express (they only take Visa & MC), but I understand why they don't.

The place is great and very close to my house, every time I have to drive to china town to  get myself chinese food, I guess I don't have to anymore(^ ^)
The lunch special is really awesome, portion is big and the price is cheap, the food is tasty, only the beef a bit sweet though.....

Looking for a quick lunch spot in the area, we ended up walking in around 12:30.

We found a seat and they brought a menu out to us for us to decide what we wanted to eat. I ordered the honey walnut shrimp from the lunch menu. I don't usually order that dish, but it sounded good on that day. 

The food arrived relatively quickly and the it was standard fast food fare. Portions were generous and service was standard.
